description: Prime constant: decimal value of (A010051 interpreted as a binary number).
comments: Comments from Ferenc Adorjan (fadorjan(AT)freemail.hu): "Decimal expansion of the representation of the sequence of primes by a single real in (0,1)."Any monotonic integer sequence can be represented by a real number in (0, 1) such a way that in the binary representation of the real, the n-th fractional digit is 1 if and only if n is in the sequence."Examples of the inverse mapping are A092855 and A092857." (End)
